Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • ClubAbstractEntity
                • Person
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Soldier, Student

    public class Person
extends ClubAbstractEntity
    public class Person extends ClubAbstractEntity which means each person entitiy is also a JFrame by itself.
    this class holds several String instance variables id, name surname, tel that are the Person's details.
    it also holds two arrays:
    1.textFields which is a JTextField array. this array will hold each variable user input for each field
    2. errors which is a JLabel array. this array will hold all the asterkis ('*') that indicated a validation error
    each array is needed for later use of its data. (hide\show relevant '*', validate, etc)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Person()
      Person empty constructor - this constructor meant for searching and updating clubber data.
      Person(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String surName, java.lang.String tel)
      Person 4 parameters constructor - creates a Person with the given information.
      each person will be created only after data validation.
      The constructor creates a panel with the relevant text-fields and labels and than adds this panel into a larger panel.
      Each small panel is made of 1 label (ID, Name, etc),a texfield,and an hidden '*'.
      Than each small panel is being added to the main panel- Person (each person is also a JPanel and a ClubAbstractEntity - as mentioned)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Person

        public Person()
        Person empty constructor - this constructor meant for searching and updating clubber data.
        will invoke person's 4 parameter constructor with 'null' values, will disable the cancel button ClubAbstractEntity.cancel_Button(boolean), and set the window to be visible. Window.setVisible(boolean)

      • Person

        public Person(java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String surName,
              java.lang.String tel)
        Person 4 parameters constructor - creates a Person with the given information.
        each person will be created only after data validation.
        The constructor creates a panel with the relevant text-fields and labels and than adds this panel into a larger panel.
        Each small panel is made of 1 label (ID, Name, etc),a texfield,and an hidden '*'.
        Than each small panel is being added to the main panel- Person (each person is also a JPanel and a ClubAbstractEntity - as mentioned)
        Parameters:
        id - Clubber's ID
        name - Clubber's First name
        surName - Clubber's Surname
        tel - Clubber's Phone number

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public boolean match(java.lang.String key)

        this method check if the user id - entered in the relevant JTextfield (JTextField)
        Specified by:
        match in class ClubAbstractEntity
        Parameters:
        key - this is the user input id. (to check for matches in the DB)
        Returns:
        true if key matches the id field.

      • validateData

        protected boolean validateData()
        This method overrides inherited abstract method validateData()
        this method will validate the data (data is being treated as a regular expression) entered by the user in the next sequence:
        ID field RE: '\\d-\\d{7}\\|[1-9]':
        digit, followed by '-', followed by 7 digits, followed by '|', followed by a non-zero digit (e.g. 0-2423535|1)
        name field RE: '[A-Z][a-z]+':
        capital letter, followed by at least one lower-case letter (e.g. Zohar)
        surname field RE: '([A-Z][a-z]*('|-)?)+':
        capital letter, followed by 0 or more lowercase letters, followed by 0 or 1 occurrences of: "'" or '-' (e.g. Mc'Cormic)
        Tel field RE: '\\+\\([1-9]\\d{0,2}\\)[1-9]\\d{0,2}-[1-9]\\d{6}':
        international land/mobile-phone number (e.g. +(1)4-9520205)
        First digit after left-bracket must be non-zero
        Each time the user click the ClubAbstractEntity.okButton, validateData() is being invoked and the validation proccess takes place once again.
        in each invokation, the loop goes through all the validPatterns and all the textFields and check for a match.
        if a mach was not found in one of the textfields, an error asteriks becomes visible and the loop breaks.
        if the mistake is fixed, but theres a mistake in another field (in the next time we'll press the okButton),
        the previous askteriks will be hidden, and the relevant field asteriks will be shown.
        Specified by:
        validateData in class ClubAbstractEntity
        Returns:
        true if the content has been validated.

      • commit

        protected void commit()
        this method overrides inherited abstract method commit().
        this method will set the validated and relevant data to the correct instance variable field,
        and invoke ClubAbstractEntity.cancel_Button(boolean) which will enable the cancel button. (according to "true" state sent to function)
        Specified by:
        commit in class ClubAbstractEntity

      • rollBack

        protected void rollBack()
        override method rollBack() - reverse the operation and setting each text filed back to its original values.
        which means take the instance variables values, and enter them to the textfields
        Specified by:
        rollBack in class ClubAbstractEntity
